block.p: Laura Elizabeth Keeton and Henry Hanna McVey were married yesterday by the Rev. Joe D. Reynolds, an Episcopal priest, at Christ Church Cathedral in Houston.

Mrs. McVey, 30, is a director of corporate media relations in New York for I.B.M. She graduated from Duke University. She is a daughter of Susan and Richard Keeton of Houston, where her father is a partner in Mayor, Day, Caldwell & Keeton, a law firm, and her mother is a landscape historian.
Laura Elizabeth Keeton and Henry Hanna McVey were married yesterday by the Rev. Joe D. Reynolds, an Episcopal priest, at Christ Church Cathedral in Houston.

Mrs. McVey, 30, is a director of corporate media relations in New York for I.B.M. She graduated from Duke University. She is a daughter of Susan and Richard Keeton of Houston, where her father is a partner in Mayor, Day, Caldwell & Keeton, a law firm, and her mother is a landscape historian.

Mr. McVey, 31, is a vice president and the senior stock analyst covering the securities industry for Morgan Stanley Dean Witter in New York. He graduated from the University of Virginia and received an M.B.A. from the University of Pennsylvania. His parents, Nan and George McVey, live in Richmond, Va., where his mother is an interior decorator and his father retired as the headmaster of St. Christopher's School. The bridegroom's father is now the president of the Virginia Council for Private Education in Richmond, which does lobbying and oversees the accreditation of private elementary and secondary schools in Virginia.
